content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: Rajasthans 14 Million Tonne Lithium Reserve Set To Reduce India's Dependence On China
content: A 14 million tonne lithium reserve in Rajasthan could make India self-reliant in the critical mineral and reduce dependence on China.

title: BJP Slams DK Shivakumar For Not Answering Some Questions In Karnataka Caste Survey
content: The Congress government's ongoing socio-economic and educational survey in Karnataka has come under sharp attack from the Opposition after Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar declined to answer some questions asked by enumerators.

title: Thackeray Brothers Meet Again, Signal Political Reunion Ahead Of Civic Polls
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray reached Matoshree - house of Shiv Sena UBT chief Uddhav Thackeray -- for the second time in recent months on Saturday, marking his fifth meeting with his cousin this year.

title: Mohan Bhagwat's "I Have To Take It Back" Comment On PoK Draws Applause
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has called Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) a room in a house called India, but one in which strangers have moved in.

title: Video: Lion Attacks Lioness In Gujarat's Gir, She Fights Back
content: Rajya Sabha member and wildlife enthusiast Parimal Nathwani has shared a video capturing the dramatic interaction between a lion and a lioness in the Gir Forest in Gujarat.

title: Political Row Begins Over Delay In Maharashtra Flood Relief
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who is in Maharashtra's Ahilyanagar for a series of cooperative sector events, assured that the Centre will not delay assistance to flood-affected farmers once the state government submits its report.

title: "Clearly Can't Run Government": Tejashwi Yadav On Nitish Kumar's Viral Video
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday alleged that Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's "erratic" behaviour at a function of Prime Minister Narendra Modi a day ago has given rise to fresh suspicions about his "mental health".

title: Fair Prices, More Flights: Aviation Body To Airlines Before Diwali Rush
content: As the aviation sector braces for one of its busiest travel periods of the year, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has stepped in to prevent sharp fare hikes ahead of the Diwali season.

title: Will US Government Shutdown Affect 2026 Poll? Recent History Provides Clues
content: Political leaders in Washington are spending considerable energy blaming the other party for what could be an extended government shutdown, and that effort includes shaping the narrative for next year's elections.

title: Man Arrested For Sexually Abusing 7-Year-Old Girl In Car In Goa: Cops
content: A man was arrested on Sunday for allegedly sexually abusing a 7-year-old girl in his car, a Goa police official said.

title: Almost 1,000 Trapped In Blizzard On Tibetan Side Of Mount Everest
content: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday to clear access to campsites on Tibet's eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people have been trapped by a blizzard that has blocked roads, according to Chinese state media reports.

title: "I Worked Hard": Mohammed Azharuddin On Land For New Cemetery In Hyderabad
content: Former Team India captain and Congress leader Mohammed Azharuddin has thanked Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy and the State Waqf Board for allocating land for a new cemetery in Hyderabad.

title: Postal Services Resume In Manipur's Churachandpur 2 Years After Ethnic Violence
content: Postal services in Manipur's Churachandpur resumed on Saturday, two years after it was shut down due to the Meitei-Kuki ethnic violence.

title: Alcoholic Father Stabs 1-Year-Old Son To Death In UP: Cops
content: A man has been arrested here for allegedly stabbing his one-year-old son to death in an inebriated state, police said on Sunday.

title: UK Police To Get Greater Powers To Restrict Protests
content: UK police are to be given greater powers to restrict protests as a minister said repeated large-scale pro-Palestinian demonstrations had caused "considerable fear" for the Jewish community.

title: 17 Dead In Darjeeling After Heavy Rain Triggers Landslides, Sikkim Cut Off
content: Seventeen people have died in West Bengal's Darjeeling after heavy rain triggered landslides and cut off road connectivity on key routes. Officials have said the calamity has cut off connectivity to the Himalayan state of Sikkim.

title: 3-Member Committee To Probe 18-Month-Old Baby's Death At Andhra Facility
content: A 3-member committee will probe into the death of an 18-month-old baby who had been left at the local Shishu Gruha or Child Care Centre, a facility run by Andhra Pradesh's Women and Child Welfare department.

title: Mamata Banerjee's Advice For Tourists Stuck In Flood-Hit Darjeeling
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Sunday expressed deep concern over the devastating floods and landslides that have killed at least 17 people in Darjeeling and cut off road connectivity to key routes, including access to Sikkim

title: No Autopsy, Officials On Holiday: Inside NDTV Probe Into Cough Syrup Deaths
content: 11 children have died in Madhya Pradesh, and six more are fighting for their lives - with what their families claimed is linked to the 'Coldrif' cough syrup.

title: Six-laning of Talapady-Chengala stretch of NH66 completed, open for traffic
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Gaza peace plan: Trump warns Hamas of 'complete obliteration'; asserts Netanyahu on board
content: US President Donald Trump has issued a stark warning to Hamas, threatening "complete obliteration" if they do not cede control of Gaza. He also pressed Israel to cease bombing for a peace deal, believing Hamas is now ready.

title: 'US tariffs over Russian oil unfair': Jaishankar stands ground, says 'issues need to be resolved'
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reiterated that US tariffs on India are "unfair," criticizing penalties for Russian oil purchases while European nations also source from Moscow. He highlighted a new level of sanctions application and the "weaponization of everything" by major powers, noting shifting global energy dynamics with the US as an exporter and China leading in renewables.

title: Darjeeling landslides: Homes, bridge, roads, tea gardens washed out ‚Äî scary visuals emerge from Bengal
content: Torrential rains have unleashed widespread devastation in Darjeeling, triggering massive landslides that claimed at least nine lives and isolated remote villages. Homes and tea gardens were buried, and a crucial bridge collapsed, disrupting transportation. Rescue efforts face challenging terrain and continuous rainfall. Authorities are monitoring the dire situation as IMD issued a red alert, urging expedited aid for affected communities.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on why he supports Trump's $100,000 H-1B Visa fee
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang supports President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee for fresh applications, calling it a "great start" to reshape immigration policy and attract the "brightest minds." He acknowledges the high cost but believes it sets a meaningful threshold. Critics, however, warn the move could lead to brain drain and undermine America's tech leadership.

title: IND vs PAK: Pakistan makes comical error, drops catch - watch
content: India posted 247 all out against Pakistan in the Women's World Cup, marked by a comical dropped catch in the 50th over when fielders collided attempting to dismiss Richa Ghosh. Despite this social media talking point and subsequent quick wickets, India set a competitive total, aiming for early dominance against Fatima Sana's side.

title: Manipur ambush: Intel hints at ‚Äòcontract killing‚Äô to undermine President‚Äôs rule
content: Intelligence agencies suspect a recent Assam Rifles convoy attack in Manipur, which killed two personnel, was a politically motivated "contract killing" aimed at destabilizing the state. This unusual incident saw no claim of responsibility from the PLA, leading to arrests of 15 members. Authorities are probing potential political support amidst ongoing ethnic tensions.

title: ‚ÄòMet terrorists four times‚Äô: Aide arrested in Pahalgam attack provided logistics
content: Mohammad Yousuf Katari was arrested for his role in the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, providing logistical support like an Android phone charger and guiding the terrorists. Officials tracked the partially destroyed charger, recovered after the terrorists were killed, leading to his capture. His interrogation is expected to uncover further links in the terror support network.

title: Jeff Bezos makes rare public appearance; says 'millions of people will live in space'
content: Jeff Bezos predicted millions will live in space within decades, choosing orbital habitats supported by robots and AI data centers. He also envisioned gigawatt-scale space data centers within 10-20 years, leveraging continuous solar power to surpass terrestrial facilities. Bezos called the current AI investment surge a "good" industrial bubble.

title: Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura welcome girl: Both mom and child doing well, confirms source
content: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura Khan have welcomed their first child, a baby girl, on Sunday, October 5, 2025. Both mother and newborn are reportedly in good health, bringing immense joy to the entire Khan family. Salman Khan is returning to Mumbai to celebrate this happy occasion.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
content: The US Space Force awarded SpaceX five of seven critical military launch contracts totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space missions. United Launch Alliance secured the remaining two missions for $428 million. Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket remains uncertified for these National Security Space Launch missions, missing out on this cycle's awards.

title: Did Pak ‚Äòunfairly‚Äô win toss against IND? Controversial call sparks debate ‚Äì Watch
content: A toss controversy erupted during the India vs Pakistan ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup match. Pakistan captain Fatima Sana seemingly called ‚Äútails,‚Äù but the official declared ‚Äúheads,‚Äù resulting in Pakistan winning the toss. This incident, which saw Pakistan opt to bowl first, sparked widespread online debate and questions about fairness, with no official clarification yet.

title: 'Went to build better future': How robbery attempt claimed Indian student's life in US
content: A 28-year-old Hyderabad student, Pole Chandrasekhar, was fatally shot in Texas, US, on October 3 during a suspected armed robbery at his part-time gas station job. Chandrasekhar, who was pursuing a master's, died on the spot. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy expressed condolences and assured government support to repatriate his remains, with coordination underway with Indian officials.

title: India, UK kick off high-voltage 'Konkan' naval exercise in Indian Ocean
content: India and the UK commenced their major `Konkan` naval exercise in the western Indian Ocean, deploying aircraft carriers, warships, and fighters. Led by INS Vikrant and HMS Prince of Wales, the biennial drills aim to enhance interoperability and reinforce a free and open Indo-Pacific, ahead of British PM Keir Starmer‚Äôs visit. This exercise strengthens strategic ties and regional maritime stability.

title: Nepal hit by Monsoon: At least 51 dead in landslides, flood; evacuations under way
content: At least 51 people died in landslides and flooding in Ilam, Eastern Nepal, over the past 24 hours, with authorities expecting the death toll to rise. Security forces are evacuating residents in Kathmandu Valley as rivers swell. Several districts face high risk, and nearly two million people could be affected by the unexpected, renewed monsoon downpours.

title: Darjeeling landslides: Toll rises to 18; Mamata to visit affected areas tomorrow
content: Torrential rains have unleashed devastating landslides across Darjeeling and Kalimpong hills, claiming at least nine lives and leaving several missing. Vital roads are cut off, and bridges damaged, severely disrupting daily life. Rescue operations are underway amidst challenging conditions.

title: Saquon Barkley set to play vs Broncos: Eagles RB cleared after injury scare
content: The Super Bowl LIX champion Philadelphia Eagles are off to a dominant 4-0 start and are set to face the Denver Broncos today. Star running back Saquon Barkley is confirmed to play despite missing some practice, with the team's injury report not listing him.

title: Harvard trained gastroenterologist reveals 10 best foods for gas and bloating
content: Bloating occurs when excess air or gas buildup gets trapped in the digestive tract or when gut muscles fail to move food efficiently. This can be triggered by eating too fast and swallowing air, consuming gas-producing foods or food intolerances. The good news is that certain foods can actively soothe the digestive system by providing enzymes that break down food efficiently.

title: Mount Everest blizzard: Nearly 1k trapped on Tibetan side; rescue ops on
content: A severe blizzard has left nearly 1,000 stranded on Mount Everest's Tibetan side, with rescue efforts underway amid heavy snowfall. Concurrently, devastating rains in Nepal triggered landslides and flash floods, causing at least 47 deaths and leaving nine missing. Authorities in both regions are intensifying relief operations to reach affected communities and stranded visitors.

title: Bugs attack! Ind-Pak match paused for bizarre reason - watch
content: The ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unusual challenge as a persistent swarm of flies disrupted play, visibly bothering players from both sides. Despite the insect nuisance, India reached 136 for 3 after 30 overs against Pakistan, who won the toss and chose to bowl.

title: ‚ÄòBlood will pave way to victory‚Äô: Top Hamas leader‚Äôs defiant first appearance post-Doha attack
content: Hamas negotiator Khalil al-Hayya delivered a defiant message after an Israeli strike killed his son, expressing hope for victory through sacrifice. His statement aired as indirect talks between Israel and Hamas were set to resume in Cairo, following Hamas's positive reception to a Trump-proposed peace plan for hostage exchange. Al-Hayya's focus remained on Gazan suffering.

title: Chess: Nakamura's controversial gesture towards Gukesh enrages fans - watch
content: The USA dominated India 5-0 in the 'Checkmate' event, with Hikaru Nakamura defeating world champion D Gukesh. However, Nakamura's post-match gesture of throwing Gukesh's king piece towards the crowd sparked widespread controversy and divided social media opinion. This incident now sets the stage for an intense return leg in India.

title: Flash floods alert in Bengal: Bhutan's Tala dam overflows; NDRF on 'highest alert'
content: North Bengal is on high alert as Bhutan's Tala hydropower dam overflows due to a gate malfunction, raising fears of downstream flooding in West Bengal's Dooars. This situation compounds deadly landslides in Darjeeling, which killed at least seven people, prompting NDRF deployment and Prime Minister Modi's assurance of central assistance amidst ongoing heavy rainfall forecasts.

title: Brady Quinn replaces Mark Sanchez on FOX after ex-QB‚Äôs stabbing, arrest
content: FOX Sports analyst Mark Sanchez was hospitalized and arrested in Indianapolis. He faced battery charges following a stabbing incident. This forced a last-minute change for the Colts versus Raiders game broadcast. Former NFL quarterback Brady Quinn stepped in as the replacement analyst. Quinn, a familiar face from college football coverage, took over Sanchez's duties on short notice.

title: Karur stampede: Police books TVK chief Vijay's campaign vehicle driver; SIT begins probe
content: Tamil Nadu Police registered a case against actor-politician Vijay‚Äôs campaign vehicle driver and his party, TVK, after an accident involving fans. The Madras High Court strongly criticised authorities for inaction, ordering a hit-and-run case against Vijay himself, condemning his party's irresponsibility for fleeing two collision scenes. A Special Investigation Team has also begun probing the Karur stampede tragedy.

title: Tehran cuts ties with IAEA after 'snapback sanctions'; ends Cairo Agreement
content: Iran announced it ended cooperation with the UN nuclear watchdog, IAEA, citing reimposed ‚Äúsnapback‚Äù sanctions and recent military tensions. Foreign Minister Araghchi declared the Cairo Agreement invalid, criticising Western pressure tactics. This decision follows a June war where Israel, then the US, attacked Iranian nuclear sites, leading to Iran's retaliation and a ceasefire.

title: LeBron James‚Äô wife Savannah and daughter Zhuri go viral with surprise dance video
content: LeBron James' wife Savannah and daughter Zhuri recently captivated Instagram with their viral dance moves, momentarily overshadowing the NBA star. Beyond the fun, Savannah revealed how Zhuri profoundly inspired her to introspect and launch the "Let It Break" initiative. This mother-daughter bond highlights Savannah's journey of self-discovery and ambition, proving her multi-talented personality extends beyond family life.

title: 'Ready to stay in jail': Sonam Wangchuk demands judicial probe in Ladakh protest deaths
content: Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk, currently held in Jodhpur Central Jail, has called for peace and unity among Ladakhis. He demands an independent judicial inquiry into the killing of four protestors during recent violent unrest in Leh, which erupted over statehood and Sixth Schedule demands. Wangchuk, detained under NSA, advocates for a peaceful, non-violent struggle.

title: Handshake drama continues! Harmanpreet Kaur ignores Pak captain at toss at Women's World Cup
content: The India-Pakistan Women‚Äôs World Cup match in Colombo commenced with palpable tension as captains Harmanpreet Kaur and Fatima Sana skipped the traditional handshake. This gesture mirrored heightened political and sporting unease, with BCCI officials confirming a non-committal stance on sportsmanship, aligning with the men‚Äôs team. India, confident after a prior win, face a struggling Pakistan side.

title: Watch: Rowdy celebrates birthday behind bars in B'luru; cake cutting video goes viral
content: A viral video shows undertrial prisoner Gubbachhi Seena celebrating his birthday with cake and a large knife inside Bengaluru's Central Prison, prompting an ADGP inquiry. The celebration, recorded on a mobile phone, occurred months ago. Seena, accused of murder, had his rival's wife expose the clip. Police are now investigating mobile phone entry and facilitation of the event.

title: It‚Äôs a girl! Arbaaz and Sshura Khan welcome their first child
content: Bollywood actor Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura Khan welcomed a baby girl today, October 5, 2025. The Khan family, including Salman Khan, celebrates the new arrival. Sshura was admitted to the hospital yesterday. Salman Khan returned from Panvel to join the family. Arbaaz had confirmed Sshura's pregnancy in June. He expressed excitement about becoming a father again.

title: Bad Bunny mocks conservative news network on latest SNL episode
content: Bad Bunny, the Latino rapper and LGBTQ+ ally, is reportedly being considered to headline the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show. He recently joked on SNL that even Fox News, which was previously furious about his potential involvement, is now happy about the prospect. This highlights a surprising shift in perception.

title: ‚ÄòLives could've been saved‚Äô: Arrested doc suspended in cough syrup case
content: A paediatrician in Madhya Pradesh was suspended and arrested after 11 children died from kidney failure linked to contaminated Coldrif syrup he prescribed. The syrup contained toxic diethylene glycol, leading to an ongoing investigation into the full chain of responsibility. Authorities have banned the syrup, initiated multi-state inspections, and announced compensation for affected families.

title: 'End of an era': Rohit‚Äôs old post goes viral as Gill replaces him as ODI captain
content: Shubman Gill has been appointed India's new ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, and will also lead in Tests. This leadership change streamlines captaincy across formats, with Rohit retained as a specialist batter. Significant squad changes include dropping key bowlers and appointing Shreyas Iyer as ODI vice-captain, marking a major transition in Indian cricket.

title: 'Dragged by hair, paraded in Israeli flag': Eyewitnesses detail Greta's detention
content: Eyewitnesses on a Gaza aid flotilla reported Greta Thunberg was dragged, beaten, and paraded by Israeli forces after her detention. A Swedish official's email corroborated mistreatment, including bedbugs and insufficient food. Other detainees also faced abuse, with an Israeli minister calling them "terrorists," marking Thunberg's second such arrest.

title: New toll rules: Get FASTag now or pay extra! Cash users to pay double ‚Äì check details
content: From November 15, 2025, National Highway toll plazas will implement new rules to boost digital payments. Vehicles without a valid FASTag will pay double the fee in cash or 1.25 times via UPI. This move aims to enhance efficiency, reduce congestion, and improve the user experience on highways.
